title: 111_hr550
content: The "Get America Moving Again Act of 2009" includes a temporary credit for the purchase of passenger vehicles under section 30E of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Get America Moving Again Act of 2009" offers a tax credit for the purchase of qualified passenger vehicles. The credit is based on the purchase price and has maximum limits depending on whether the vehicle is new or used. The tax credit for qualified passenger vehicles under the "Get America Moving Again Act of 2009" has maximum limits based on the vehicle's placement in service. For vehicles placed in service before January 1, 2010, the credit is capped at $2,000, and for those placed in service during 2010, the limit is $1,000. Additionally, the credit amount allowed is reduced based on the taxpayer's adjusted gross income. The tax credit for qualified passenger vehicles under the "Get America Moving Again Act of 2009" has maximum limits based on the vehicle's placement in service. The term 'modified adjusted gross income' is defined as the adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for the taxable year increased by any amount excluded from gross income under specific sections. A qualified passenger vehicle is any motor vehicle if the model year is not more than 3 years earlier than the most recent model year available for purchase. The "Get America Moving Again Act of 2009" provides a tax credit for qualified passenger vehicles meeting specific criteria. The vehicle must be acquired for personal use, cost under $50,000, and have a gross vehicle weight rating of no more than 8,500 pounds. Rules similar to depreciation allowances apply for determining the price. The credit is part of the general business credit and is based on the property's depreciation allowance. The tax credit allowed under subsection (a) for any taxable year is treated as a credit allowable under subpart A, with limitations based on the amount of tax for the year. The tax credit under subsection (a) is subject to limitations based on the amount of tax for the year. Special rules apply, including basis reduction for property eligible for the credit and restrictions on property used outside the United States. This section specifically applies to vehicles. The tax credit for vehicles under subsection (a) is subject to limitations based on the amount of tax for the year. Special rules apply, including basis reduction for eligible property and restrictions on international use. This section applies to vehicles placed in service after the enactment date and before January 1, 2011. Conforming amendments are made to sections 26(a)(1), 1016(a), and a new section 30E is added to the tax code. The amendments made by section 30E provide a temporary credit for purchasing passenger vehicles, effective for taxable years ending after the enactment date of the Act.
